issue.title: Implement a database service for DAGs
issue.body:
- Find out which would be an ideal database for storing/fetching DAGs
- This issue can be used for discussions.

Checklist for this task:
- [ ] Finalize a database ideal for this purpose.
- [ ] Implement a database service for storing/retrieving/modifying DAGs for tasks.
- [ ] Expose CPIs for accessing this service
- [ ] Write unit-tests for this service

issue.title: Implement Scheduler service
issue.body:
The scheduler service should perform the following:

- [ ] Get constant health information from workers (alive/crashed).
- [ ] Get constant capability information from workers (which tasks they can execute).
- [ ] Receive task requests from the Request Queue and process them (construct executable item for workers).
- [ ] Decide which worker the task should be assigned to, and forward to that worker.
- [ ] Get constant status update about task from worker.
- [ ] Send task completion message (success/failed) to Orchestrator via Response queue.
- [ ] Ability to reschedule the task to a new worker, if current worker crashes.
- [ ] Ability to prioritize task scheduling on worker. Higher priority tasks go first.
- [ ] If CPI/API needed, then implement them.
- [ ] Implement unit-tests for scheduler service

issue.title: [Discussion] Scheduler vs Message Broker
issue.body:
During the presentation last Friday, we had a question: **_"Why do we need a separate Scheduler Service?"_**. The issue in particular was, do we have the workers **PULL** work, or we **PUSH** work to them?

I personally vouched for having a scheduler to push work, instead of directly using the message-broker where the workers pull tasks. We can have further discussion on this topic here.

issue.title: Implement Job Submission Task
issue.body:
The job submission task currently assumes the following 2 aspects:
* Cloud Job Submission
* HPC Job Submission

This issue is a child to #5

issue.title: [Discussion] Which services need to be made Highly Available
issue.body:
During our presentation last week, Marlon (@marpierc ) raised a very valid question:  _**"Which services need to be made highly available?"**_

Our initial idea was to implement all services **without** HA, and later enhance the services using Zookeeper to make them HA. But do all services need to be made HA? As Suresh (@smarru ) pointed out, we need to consider points such as:

- Whether the service maintains state information?
- Whether service data need to be replicated for HA?

I would love to hear more about what you guys feel. Please post via comments here.

issue.title: Implement Worker Service
issue.body:
The worker should perform the following:
- [ ] Run/Execute the task assigned to it.
- [ ] Advertise health information, as well as task execution capability to scheduler.
- [ ] Communicate with external resources (HPC cluster or Cloud)
- [ ] Implement unit tests for worker service
